de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.failurehandling

Class FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.failurehandling.FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE>
  • Type Parameters:
    RECOVER_TYPE - The return type of the recover functions.

    public class FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE>
extends java.lang.Object
    Information about a failure that occurred while running Beagle. Besides a message and information about the causing (or indicating) exception, a failure report may continue information on how to recover from a failure. The failure reported through this report is considered non-recoverable until a recover function has be set through recoverable(), retryWith(java.util.function.Supplier<RECOVER_TYPE>) or continueWith(java.util.function.Supplier<RECOVER_TYPE>).

    • Method Detail

      • message

        public FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE> message(java.lang.String message,
                                           java.lang.Object... values)
        Supplies a message describing the failure. The message will be evaluated through String.format(String, Object...).
        Parameters:
        message - A message describing the failure. Must not be null.
        values - Format values, will be passed to String.format(String, Object...).
        Returns:
        this.

      • details

        public FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE> details(java.lang.String message,
                                           java.lang.Object... values)
        Supplies a message giving details about the failure. The message will be evaluated through String.format(String, Object...) and be perepended to potentally already existing details.
        Parameters:
        message - Details about the reported failure.
        values - Format values, will be passed to String.format(String, Object...).
        Returns:
        this.

      • cause

        public FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE> cause(java.lang.Exception cause)
        Supplies the exception that caused or indicated the failure. If no message has been set on this report yet, the report’s message will be set to cause.getMessage(). The exception’s stacktrace will be appnended to the report’s details. A new report’s cause is null.
        Parameters:
        cause - The exception that caused or indicated the failure. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        this.

      • recoverable

        public FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE> recoverable()
        Reports that the failure is recoverable by continuing the normal control flow after the failure handling. The failure reporter will receive null as the result of handling this report.
        Returns:
        this.

      • continueWith

        public FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE> continueWith(java.util.function.Supplier<RECOVER_TYPE> continueAt)
        Reports that the failure is recoverable by continuing by running continueAt .
        Parameters:
        continueAt - A function defining how to continue while skipping the failed action. Supplies the value the failure reporter should use instead of the one that was expected to be generated skipped action.
        Returns:
        this.

      • continueWith

        public FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE> continueWith(java.lang.Runnable continueAt)
        Reports that the failure is recoverable by continuing by running continueAt . The failure reporter will receive null as the result of handling this report.
        Parameters:
        continueAt - A runnable defining how to continue while skipping the failed action.
        Returns:
        this.

      • retryWith

        public FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE> retryWith(java.util.function.Supplier<RECOVER_TYPE> retryAt)
        Reports that the failure is recoverable by retrying the failed action by running retryAt.
        Parameters:
        retryAt - A function defining how to retry the failed action. Supplies the value the reporter should use instead of the one that was expected to be generated by the failed action.
        Returns:
        this.

      • retryWith

        public FailureReport<RECOVER_TYPE> retryWith(java.lang.Runnable retryAt)
        Reports that the failure is recoverable by retrying the failed action by running retryAt. The failure reporter will receive null as the result of handling this report.
        Parameters:
        retryAt - A runnable defining how to retry the failed action.
        Returns:
        this.

        Returns:

      • getFailureCause

        public java.lang.Exception getFailureCause()
        Gets the exception that caused or indicated the reported failure.
        Returns:
        The causing exception. null indicates that the reported failure was not caused by an exception.
        See Also:
        cause(Exception)

      • getContinueRoutine

        public java.util.function.Supplier<RECOVER_TYPE> getContinueRoutine()
        Gets the function that lets Beagle continue the analysis by skipping the failed action.
        Returns:
        The function detailing how to continue. null indicates that Beagle cannot continue without the failed action.
        See Also:
        recoverable(), continueWith(Runnable)

      • getRetryRoutine

        public java.util.function.Supplier<RECOVER_TYPE> getRetryRoutine()
        Gets the function that lets Beagle retry the failed failed action.
        Returns:
        The function detailing how to retry the failed action. null indicates that the failed action cannot be retried.
        See Also:
        retryWith(Runnable)
